children.text: Chapter 19 – Transitional Rules Article 61 – Transitional Rules
children.html: Chapter 19 – Transitional Rules Article 61 – Transitional Rules

children.text:
A Taxable Person's opening balance sheet for Corporate Tax purposes
          shall be the closing balance sheet prepared for financial reporting
          purposes under accounting standards applied in the State on the last
          day of the Financial Year that ends immediately before their first Tax
          Period commences, subject to any conditions or adjustments that may be
          prescribed by the Minister.The opening balance sheet referred to in Clause 1 of this Article
          shall be prepared taking into consideration the arm's length principle
          in accordance with Article 34 of this Decree- Law.For the purposes of Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, and as an
          exception to the provisions of Article 70 of this Decree-Law, the
          provisions of Article 50 of this Decree-Law shall apply to
          transactions or arrangements entered into on or after the date this
          Decree-Law is published in the Official Gazette.The Cabinet may, at the suggestion of the Minister, issue a decision
          prescribing other transitional measures related to the implementation
          of this Decree-Law and the application of its provisions.
children.html:
1. A Taxable Person's opening balance sheet for Corporate Tax purposes shall be the closing balance sheet prepared for financial reporting purposes under accounting standards applied in the State on the last day of the Financial Year that ends immediately before their first Tax Period commences, subject to any conditions or adjustments that may be prescribed by the Minister.

  2. The opening balance sheet referred to in Clause 1 of this Article shall be prepared taking into consideration the arm's length principle in accordance with Article 34 of this Decree- Law.

  3. For the purposes of Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, and as an exception to the provisions of Article 70 of this Decree-Law, the provisions of Article 50 of this Decree-Law shall apply to transactions or arrangements entered into on or after the date this Decree-Law is published in the Official Gazette.

  4. The Cabinet may, at the suggestion of the Minister, issue a decision prescribing other transitional measures related to the implementation of this Decree-Law and the application of its provisions.

children.text: Chapter 20 – Closing provisions Article 62 – Delegation of Power
children.html: Chapter 20 – Closing provisions Article 62 – Delegation of Power

children.text:
The Minister may delegate his powers under this Decree-Law, in full or in
      part, to the Authority, where the Minister deems appropriate.
children.html: The Minister may delegate his powers under this Decree-Law, in full or in part, to the Authority, where the Minister deems appropriate.

children.text: Article 63 – Administrative Policies and Procedures
children.html: Article 63 – Administrative Policies and Procedures

children.text:
The administrative policies, procedures and general instructions in
      relation to the requirements imposed on a Person under this Decree-Law
      shall be issued by the Authority in coordination with the Ministry.
children.html: The administrative policies, procedures and general instructions in relation to the requirements imposed on a Person under this Decree-Law shall be issued by the Authority in coordination with the Ministry.

children.text: Article 64 – Cooperating with the Authority
children.html: Article 64 – Cooperating with the Authority

children.text:
All governmental authorities in the State shall fully cooperate with the
      Authority to carry out whatever is required to implement the provisions of
      this Decree-Law and provide the Authority with any data, information and
      documentation in respect of a Taxable Person or an Exempt Person as may be
      requested by the Authority.
children.html: All governmental authorities in the State shall fully cooperate with the Authority to carry out whatever is required to implement the provisions of this Decree-Law and provide the Authority with any data, information and documentation in respect of a Taxable Person or an Exempt Person as may be requested by the Authority.

children.text: Article 65 – Revenue Sharing
children.html: Article 65 – Revenue Sharing

children.text:
Corporate Tax revenues and Administrative Penalties collected under this
      Decree-Law shall be subject to sharing between the Federal Government and
      the Local Governments based on the provisions of a federal law issued in
      this regard.
children.html: Corporate Tax revenues and Administrative Penalties collected under this Decree-Law shall be subject to sharing between the Federal Government and the Local Governments based on the provisions of a federal law issued in this regard.

children.text: Article 66 – International Agreements
children.html: Article 66 – International Agreements

children.text:
To the extent the terms of an international agreement that is in force in
      the State are inconsistent with the provisions of this Decree-Law, the
      terms of the international agreement shall prevail.
children.html: To the extent the terms of an international agreement that is in force in the State are inconsistent with the provisions of this Decree-Law, the terms of the international agreement shall prevail.

children.text: Article 67 – Implementing Decisions
children.html: Article 67 – Implementing Decisions

children.text:
Subject to the powers conferred to the Cabinet under this Decree-Law,
          the Minister and the Authority shall issue the necessary decisions,
          within their respective powers, to implement the provisions of this
          Decree-Law.The Cabinet may, at the suggestion of the Minister, issue implementing
          decisions for this Decree-Law.
children.html:
1. Subject to the powers conferred to the Cabinet under this Decree-Law, the Minister and the Authority shall issue the necessary decisions, within their respective powers, to implement the provisions of this Decree-Law.

  2. The Cabinet may, at the suggestion of the Minister, issue implementing decisions for this Decree-Law.

children.text: Article 68 – Cancellation of Conflicting Provisions
children.html: Article 68 – Cancellation of Conflicting Provisions

children.text:
Any text or provisions contrary to or inconsistent with the provisions of
      this Decree-Law shall be abrogated.
children.html: Any text or provisions contrary to or inconsistent with the provisions of this Decree-Law shall be abrogated.

children.text: Article 69 – Application of this Decree-Law to Tax Periods
children.html: Article 69 – Application of this Decree-Law to Tax Periods

children.text:
This Decree-Law shall apply to Tax Periods commencing on or after 1 June
      2023.
children.html: This Decree-Law shall apply to Tax Periods commencing on or after 1 June 2023.

children.text: Article 70 – Publication and Application of this Decree-Law
children.html: Article 70 – Publication and Application of this Decree-Law

children.text:
This Decree-Law shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come
      into effect (15) fifteen days following the date of publication.
children.html: This Decree-Law shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into effect (15) fifteen days following the date of publication.
